definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: Drunk about the place and capering with Martin's umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 她喝得醉醺醺的，掄着馬丁的雨傘歡蹦亂跳。

sentences.english: Someone has made off with my umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 有人把我的雨傘偷走了。

sentences.english: It's showery today. Take an umbrella with you.
sentences.chinese: 今天有陣雨，帶上雨傘吧。

sentences.english: It's wet. Don't forget your umbrella and raincoat.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了很溼，別忘了你的雨傘和雨衣。

sentences.english: Although the sun was shining the other day, my father took the umbrella with him to be on the safe side.
sentences.chinese: 雖然那天陽光明媚，我父親還是帶上了雨傘以防不測。

sentences.english: In England , you go, you should an umbrella .
sentences.chinese: 在英國，不管你去哪兒，你都應帶把雨傘。

sentences.english: He restored the umbrella he had taken by mistake.
sentences.chinese: 他把拿錯了的雨傘放回原處。

sentences.english: Somewhere along the way I lost my umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 我把雨傘丟失在沿途某處了。

sentences.english: Compared with England, umbrella the big dissimilitude then is interesting in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 同英國相比，雨傘在日本則大相異趣。

sentences.english: Mushrooms always grow in damp places, which is why they look unbrellas.
sentences.chinese: 香菇都生在陰溼的地方，因此它們長的都像雨傘。

sentences.english: There's a man in the habit of hitting me on the head with an umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 有人愛用雨傘打我的頭。

sentences.english: His manager framed a theft against him. saying the undergraduate stole an ultraviolet-proof umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 他的經理誣告說大學生偷了一把防紫外線的雨傘。

sentences.english: Fill with dry food, Daiyu San clear, accumulated bit by bit, and conditions are ripe.
sentences.chinese: 飽帶乾糧，晴帶雨傘，點滴積累，水到渠成。

sentences.english: You don't need your umbrella or raincoat.
The wind picked up Flappy and his umbrella. Flappy was happy.
sentences.chinese: 風捲起了飛行豬和他的雨傘，飛行豬很高興。

sentences.english: They have been making oiled paper umbrellas for more than 400 years.
sentences.chinese: 他們製造油紙雨傘已經有400多年的歷史了。

definition: to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to (carry) on one's person/to (take) with one
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
